intro: Noronhia marojejyensis, commonly known as the Marojejy starling tree, is a unique plant species endemic to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of the Marojejy Massif, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Noronhia marojejyensis is notable for its ornamental value, with its vibrant foliage making it a sought-after specimen in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat-specific requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
